events.name: Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcanic eruption and tsunamis, January 2022
events.wd_label: Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcanic eruption and tsunamis, January 2022
events.wd_description: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano in Tonga erupted, causing widespread ash fallout and tsunamis across the Pacific, leading to confirmed casualties and significant disruption to telecommunications in Tonga.
events.description: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano in Tonga erupted, causing widespread ash fallout and tsunamis across the Pacific, leading to confirmed casualties and significant disruption to telecommunications in Tonga.

events.name: Volcanic eruption in Tonga
events.wd_description: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted for twelve hours, blasting ash into the atmosphere and causing significant disruption to the region.
events.description: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted for twelve hours, blasting ash into the atmosphere and causing significant disruption to the region.

events.name: Tsunami impact across the Pacific
events.wd_description: The eruption triggered tsunamis that reached as far as Peru and the United States, causing damage across the Pacific region.
events.description: The eruption triggered tsunamis that reached as far as Peru and the United States, causing damage across the Pacific region.

events.name: Telecommunications and casualty impact
events.wd_description: The eruption damaged telecommunications cables in Tonga, leaving the full extent of the damage unknown, with confirmed casualties in Tonga and Peru.
events.description: The eruption damaged telecommunications cables in Tonga, leaving the full extent of the damage unknown, with confirmed casualties in Tonga and Peru.

events.name: North Korea missile tests
events.wd_description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.
events.description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.

events.name: missile tests
events.wd_description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.
events.description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.

events.name: defense circumvention
events.wd_description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.
events.description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.

events.name: diplomatic preemption
events.wd_description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.
events.description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.

events.name: sanctions
events.wd_description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.
events.description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.

events.name: Russian Attack on Ukraine
events.wd_description: Russian forces have begun an attack on Ukraine, with reports of troops crossing the border, explosions in multiple cities, and warnings from Russian President Vladimir Putin.
events.description: Russian forces have begun an attack on Ukraine, with reports of troops crossing the border, explosions in multiple cities, and warnings from Russian President Vladimir Putin.

events.name: Initial Attack
events.wd_description: The offensive that Russia called a “special military operation” began with blasts heard around 5 a.m. Thursday, targeting various Ukrainian cities including the capital Kyiv.
events.description: The offensive that Russia called a “special military operation” began with blasts heard around 5 a.m. Thursday, targeting various Ukrainian cities including the capital Kyiv.

events.name: Invasion Strategy
events.wd_description: Russian troops crossed the border to the north and south of Ukraine, with explosions reported in multiple cities.
events.description: Russian troops crossed the border to the north and south of Ukraine, with explosions reported in multiple cities.

events.name: Statements from Putin
events.wd_description: Putin announced a military operation in the Donbas region and threatened any country that attempts to intervene on Ukraine's behalf.
events.description: Putin announced a military operation in the Donbas region and threatened any country that attempts to intervene on Ukraine's behalf.

events.name: Ukrainian Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky enacted martial law, and Ukrainian forces have taken on the first blow of the enemy and are resisting.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky enacted martial law, and Ukrainian forces have taken on the first blow of the enemy and are resisting.

events.name: Zelensky's Statements
events.wd_description: Zelensky appealed for peace but vowed that Ukraine would defend itself against the Russian attack.
events.description: Zelensky appealed for peace but vowed that Ukraine would defend itself against the Russian attack.

events.name: Martial Law Declaration
events.wd_description: Zelensky moved to enact martial law as air raid sirens rang out across Kyiv.
events.description: Zelensky moved to enact martial law as air raid sirens rang out across Kyiv.

events.name: International Reactions
events.wd_description: Immediate condemnation from the United States and its allies, with threats of “full scale” sanctions against Russia.
events.description: Immediate condemnation from the United States and its allies, with threats of “full scale” sanctions against Russia.

events.name: US Response
events.wd_description: US President Joe Biden issued a statement condemning Russia's attack and promising a united and decisive response.
events.description: US President Joe Biden issued a statement condemning Russia's attack and promising a united and decisive response.

events.name: EU Response
events.wd_description: EU leaders promised to weaken Russia’s economic base and capacity to modernize through sanctions.
events.description: EU leaders promised to weaken Russia’s economic base and capacity to modernize through sanctions.

events.name: UN Involvement
events.wd_description: The UN Security Council met to call for a peaceful resolution to the crisis, with US Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield saying Putin had “delivered a message of war.”
events.description: The UN Security Council met to call for a peaceful resolution to the crisis, with US Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield saying Putin had “delivered a message of war.”

events.name: Ground Situation
events.wd_description: Ukraine's borders are under attack from Russian forces, with explosions heard in multiple cities and residents fleeing Kyiv.
events.description: Ukraine's borders are under attack from Russian forces, with explosions heard in multiple cities and residents fleeing Kyiv.

events.name: Border Attacks
events.wd_description: Russian troops attacked border units, patrol borders, and checkpoints with artillery, heavy equipment, and small arms.
events.description: Russian troops attacked border units, patrol borders, and checkpoints with artillery, heavy equipment, and small arms.

events.name: Civilian Impact
events.wd_description: Civilians are seen leaving Kyiv and seeking shelter in subway stations, with concerns over the safety of residents amidst the attacks.
events.description: Civilians are seen leaving Kyiv and seeking shelter in subway stations, with concerns over the safety of residents amidst the attacks.

events.name: U.S. Battery Production and Recycling Funding
events.wd_label: U.S. Battery Production and Recycling Funding
events.wd_description: The Biden administration announced over $3.1 billion in funding for battery and component manufacturing, recycling, and second-life incentives to support domestic battery production and reduce reliance on foreign sources.
events.description: The Biden administration announced over $3.1 billion in funding for battery and component manufacturing, recycling, and second-life incentives to support domestic battery production and reduce reliance on foreign sources.

events.name: Battery Manufacturing Funding
events.wd_description: The Department of Energy (DOE) will allocate about $2.8 billion to support new, retrofitted, and expanded domestic operations for the production of battery materials and cell components.
events.description: The Department of Energy (DOE) will allocate about $2.8 billion to support new, retrofitted, and expanded domestic operations for the production of battery materials and cell components.

events.name: New Battery Manufacturing Facilities
events.wd_description: The funding will support the establishment of new battery manufacturing facilities in the U.S. to increase domestic production capacity.
events.description: The funding will support the establishment of new battery manufacturing facilities in the U.S. to increase domestic production capacity.

events.name: Retrofitted Battery Facilities
events.wd_description: Existing battery facilities will be retrofitted to enhance their production capabilities and efficiency.
events.description: Existing battery facilities will be retrofitted to enhance their production capabilities and efficiency.

events.name: Expanded Battery Operations
events.wd_description: The funding will support the expansion of current battery manufacturing operations to meet growing demand.
events.description: The funding will support the expansion of current battery manufacturing operations to meet growing demand.

events.name: Recycling and Second-Life Funding
events.wd_description: The DOE will allocate $60 million for the research and development of second-life sources for EV batteries and support projects to recycle EV batteries into the battery supply chain or use them in other applications.
events.description: The DOE will allocate $60 million for the research and development of second-life sources for EV batteries and support projects to recycle EV batteries into the battery supply chain or use them in other applications.

events.name: Second-Life Battery Research
events.wd_description: Funding will support research and development of second-life sources for EV batteries to extend their usability and reduce waste.
events.description: Funding will support research and development of second-life sources for EV batteries to extend their usability and reduce waste.

events.name: Battery Recycling Projects
events.wd_description: Projects will focus on recycling EV batteries into the battery supply chain to broaden access to raw materials and support sustainable practices.
events.description: Projects will focus on recycling EV batteries into the battery supply chain to broaden access to raw materials and support sustainable practices.

events.name: Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act Support
events.wd_label: Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act Support
events.wd_description: The more than $7 billion dedicated by Congress in the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will support improving the domestic battery supply chain, including nearly $3 billion for battery production and recycling programs.
events.description: The more than $7 billion dedicated by Congress in the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will support improving the domestic battery supply chain, including nearly $3 billion for battery production and recycling programs.

events.name: Battery Material Processing Grants
events.wd_description: Grants will support the creation of new manufacturing facilities for battery material processing to enhance domestic production capabilities.
events.description: Grants will support the creation of new manufacturing facilities for battery material processing to enhance domestic production capabilities.

events.name: Rare Earth Demonstration Facility Funding
events.wd_description: $140 million will fund a rare earth demonstration facility and refinery to help supply materials for lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: $140 million will fund a rare earth demonstration facility and refinery to help supply materials for lithium-ion batteries.
